THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON
07.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

seus
Crl.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(c) 2 2020/KERIA78
ORDER
Dated this the 7th day of January 2020

The petitioner is the 3' accused in Crime No.459/2014 of
Kalladikkode Police Station for having allegedly committed
offences punishable under Sections 341 and 324 r/w Section
34 IPC along with two others. The parent case was taken on
file by the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Mannarkkad as
CC No.1195/2014. The trial proceeded and both of them were
found not guilty and acquitted under Section 248(1) of Cr.P.C.
The case against the 3 accused was split up and refiled as CC
No.456/2017 as he was absconding. The petitioner now
approached this Court with a prayer to quash the proceedings
against him in view of the acquittal of the co-accused.

2. A reading of the judgment in CC No.1195/2014
indicates that even the prime witness had turned hostile and
it is specifically stated by the witness examined as PW1, that
he has mentioned the name of the accused in Ext.P1 FIS only
on the basis of some misunderstanding. The judgment has
now become final. No purpose will be served by proceeding
with the trial against the petitioner.

De sreNe)
pee
pa
Crl.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(c) 3 2020/KERIA78
In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire
proceedings in CC No.456/2017 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court, Mannarkkad stands quashed

Crl.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(c) 2 2020/KERIA78
ORDER
Dated this the 7th day of January 2020

The petitioner is the 3' accused in Crime No.459/2014 of
Kalladikkode Police Station for having allegedly committed
offences punishable under Sections 341 and 324 r/w Section
34 IPC along with two others. The parent case was taken on
file by the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Mannarkkad as
CC No.1195/2014. The trial proceeded and both of them were
found not guilty and acquitted under Section 248(1) of Cr.P.C.
The case against the 3 accused was split up and refiled as CC
No.456/2017 as he was absconding. The petitioner now
approached this Court with a prayer to quash the proceedings
against him in view of the acquittal of the co-accused.

2. A reading of the judgment in CC No.1195/2014
indicates that even the prime witness had turned hostile and
it is specifically stated by the witness examined as PW1, that
he has mentioned the name of the accused in Ext.P1 FIS only
on the basis of some misunderstanding. The judgment has
now become final. No purpose will be served by proceeding
with the trial against the petitioner.

De sreNe)
pee
pa
Crl.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(c) 3 2020/KERIA78
In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire
proceedings in CC No.456/2017 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court, Mannarkkad stands quashed under
Section 482 of Cr.P.C. and the accused is discharged.
SD/-
ASHOK MENON
